result.execSummary:
The defendant Devin JD Kasch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No contact with the co-defendants directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
The defendant may petition the Court for expungement pursuant to s. 973.015. The defendant will need to show successful completion of probation and compliance with all conditions of supervision.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Invoice for Court Appointed Attorney Fees - $705.00

Case called @ 9:25 AM Defendant Devin JD Kasch in court.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Evan J Dahl in court for Devin JD Kasch. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Count 1 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Count 2 - DRI. Court orders: S/W - 1 year probation. Conditions: AODA and follow through. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No contact with the co-defendants directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party. Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Atty Fees w/ 60 DTP or PP. DNA Sample and Surcharge. The defendant may petition the Court for expungement pursuant to s. 973.015. The defendant will need to show successful completion of probation and compliance with all conditions of supervision. Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal rights given.

Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 03:21 PM Defendant Devin JD Kasch in court.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant requests counsel. The Court questions the DE about his employment status. Defendant must pay $250 deposit by January 28, 2022 then $100 monthly starting March 1, 2022 for court appointed counsel.  NGP entered. Court orders $1000 Sig Bond. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 09:20 am.
